perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a material breach from 30 days to 10 days could be considered unreasonable and may not provide sufficient time for the breaching party to rectify the issue, especially for complex breaches. In New York, while there isn't a statutory minimum cure period for all contracts, courts often consider the reasonableness of the cure period. A 10-day cure period might be deemed unreasonably short depending on the nature of the breach, potentially rendering the termination clause unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York contract law (reasonableness standard for cure periods)
